dataList.content: <You know we only have two chances left, right, team?>
<Why don't we start with Meursault's, made by following the formula to a tee?>
Cooked with pinpoint precision, Meursault's dish looked like a picture in a cookbook came to life.
<Okay, we have something that looks like an actual serving, so that's a start.>
After having a taste of the dish, the restaurant owner quietly savored the food, contemplating on it for a while.

dataList.title: Eunbong’s Bar & Fryers
dataList.content: Gagaga...gigigi...gugugu...

<"I had to ruminate on this dish for a long time. It was an excellent serving in all tangible ways, like the smell, the taste, and the way it's presented. However, I felt that it was still missing something I couldn't quite describe with words.">

dataList.title: Eunbong’s Bar & Fryers
dataList.content: Gegegeh...gogogo...
<"And that...was professionalism as a cook. The ironic smidgen of blemish within perfection...">
<"Is why this dish cannot get a pass, unfortunately.">
He suddenly started soundling like a posh judge...
Someone pull the mask off that blighter's head. The only thing distorted 'bout him might be his crooked attitude.
...I admit defeat.
Nevertheless, I have no regrets over this battle.
<At least the chickens aren't attacking us this time.>
With only one chance remaining, Outis brought her dish to the table.
<It looks neat. Nothing too fancy, but still nice and clean.>
<What do these couple of needles on the dish mean, Outis? They look like a clock's hands.>
It's a simple decoration I added as a tribute to you, Executive Manager.
<Ohh...! I'd give it bonus points if I could.>
The restaurant owner's comment that followed was too sensational for me to put into words.

dataList.title: Eunbong’s Bar & Fryers
dataList.content: You're a mess! What are you doing, putting that freaky mask on your head?

dataList.title: Eunbong’s Bar & Fryers
dataList.content: Back in my days, we dealt with all kinds of nonsense and still lived on somehow! How are you gonna live through this unforgiving world if you get all heartbroken over something so small? Please...
Mother...was always like that.
Rather than kind, caring words, she would scold me with her nitpicky lectures.
She was so picky about chickens, too, rarely touching a piece anyone else would take in a heartbeat...
Running this restaurant, I had forgotten something important.
I…

dataList.title: Eunbong’s Bar & Fryers
dataList.content: Oh, mother...
<Now's our chance! The distortion or whatever on him is weakening!>
Look at this! Some kind of door appeared next to him!
Do we go into this?
What made Outie's dish different from the rest, anyway?
We're going in, soldiers. Let's see the end of this.
